masts.name: foremast
masts.description: a mast towards the front of the boat, shorter than the mainmast.  Supports the back edge of the jibs as well as the gaff-rigged mainsail

masts.name: mainmast
masts.description: the tallest mast.  Supports the gaff-rigged mainsail (the largest sail on te boat.)

ship.legend: It’s said that when the Wanderlight sings into fog, even the dead pause to listen.

past_voyages.description: A multi-day drift through fog where songs echoed oddly and the crew reported hearing their own voices harmonizing back at them.
While docked near a marshy inlet, a lone muskrat climbed aboard, explored the deck, and made direct eye contact with the camera before vanishing without a trace. Some believe it was an emissary.
The Wanderlight once sailed among a floating flock of Canadian Geese, their calls harmonizing with the ship’s shanties. Navigator Astra claimed the stars realigned for a moment as the flock passed.
Salix and Hex rewrote large portions of the ship’s system while afloat, leading to strange musical loops that lasted days.
